{% extends "_layouts/skeleton.html" %} {% set content %} # Folder structure of a site The default site that you downloaded contains just one `templates` subfolder, which itself contained just a single `index.html` file. This is the bare minimum Prontotype needs to serve up a site. There are other folders that Prontotype considers 'special' folders, including folders for [data files]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('data') }}), [configuration]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('config') }}) and [assets]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('assets') }}). These are all optional for simple sites but using them will open up a wide range of additional functionality to your site. The **full list of special folders** that can be used in the top-level directory of your site is as follows: * `assets` - For [assets]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('assets') }}) such as CSS (or LESS/SCSS) files, JavaScript files and images etc. * `config` - For any site-specific [configuration files]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('config') }}) that you need. * `data` - Where your [data files]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('data') }}) will live, if required. * `files` - For storing files that your site may need to serve up to users as downloads. * `templates` - Where your site's pages will live, and where [page request URLs will be routed into]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('pages') }}). Outside of these, you can add any other folders you need into your site to organise things as you see fit. {% endset %}
